intro: Korthalsella margaretae, commonly known as the Margareta's korthalsella, is a small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with small, clustered blooms that appear in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
